# Chapter 1: Data visualization with ggplot2

### Organization of a typical data science project 
```{r organization, out.width = "500px", fig.align="center", cached = TRUE, echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("organization.png")
```

### facet
```{r facet, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
      geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +
      facet_wrap(~ class, nrow = 2)

ggplot(data = mpg) +
      geom_point(mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +
      facet_grid(drv ~ cyl)
```

### show.legend
```{r show.legend, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg) +
      geom_smooth(
        mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy, color = drv),
        show.legend = FALSE )
```

### Overides the global data 
```{r overide, fig.height = 2, fig.width= 6, fig.align='center', cached = TRUE}
 ggplot(data = mpg, mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +
      geom_point(mapping = aes(color = class)) +
      geom_smooth(
        data = filter(mpg, class == "subcompact"),
        se = FALSE )
```

### geom_smooth
```{r geom_smooth, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(data = mpg, mapping = aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +
      geom_point(mapping = aes(color = class)) +
      geom_smooth(
        data = filter(mpg, class == "subcompact"),
        method = "loess", se = FALSE)
```

### geom_bar
```{r geom_bar1, fig.height = 2, fig.align='center', cached = TRUE}
p1 <- ggplot(data = diamonds) +
      geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = cut))
p2 <- ggplot(data = diamonds) +
        geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = cut, y = ..prop.., group = 1))
grid.arrange(p1,p2,nrow=1)
```

### position

* `position = "identity"` will place each object exactly where it falls in the context of the graph
* `position = "fill"` works like stacking, but makes each set of stacked bars the same height
* `position = "dodge"` places overlapping objects directly beside one another
* `position = "jitter"` adds a small amount of random noise to each point.

### Cordinate Systems

* `coord_flip()` switches the x- and y-axes.
* `coord_quickmap()` sets the aspect ratio correctly for maps
```{r map, fig.height = 2, fig.align='center', cached = TRUE}
nz <- map_data("nz")

p1 <- ggplot(nz, aes(long, lat, group = group)) +
        geom_polygon(fill = "white", color = "black")

p2 <- ggplot(nz, aes(long, lat, group = group)) +
        geom_polygon(fill = "white", color = "black") +
        coord_quickmap()

grid.arrange(p1,p2,nrow=1)
```
